website_summaries.verdict: The EA4500 is the update to the Linksys E4200 v2, designed to work with new upcoming router software from Cisco. Performance-wise it's on par as the E4200 v2, but for a chunk more change.
pros: Features the EA series' excellent Cisco Connect setup software
Very good throughput at both bands
USB for connecting storage and printers
cons: Does not offer much performance advantage over similar and lower-priced dual-bands on the market

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This linksys is lightning fast and was easy to set up. I have never set up anything tech like and I usually leave it to my husband. Heck I don't even know how to fully use my own cell phone, but this gives clear instructions on what you need to do and be sure to write down all pass codes and what not during the process. It will tell you to do that, but be sure to actually do it. Do it for yourself! It is very sleek and attractive, it does feel cheap but it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Prophet

customer_reviews.title: "Budget" router that is a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I am living in an older apartment. And, for whatever reason, there is low signal everywhere, including in the same room as the router. This could be due to construction of the building, I cannot say for sure. What I can say is I have tweaked and adjusted every possible setting to boost signal strength with no success. The user interface is a bit non-intuitive, if you haven't worked with a router interface before. On the upside, sending and receiving has consistent speed. It is noiseless. And, it is reliable. I purchased this over two years ago and it is still going strong. For a "budget" router, this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy go with Mesh
customer_reviews.text: I had this router for 2-3 years and never got close to my speed with it. It was easy to set up etc but the top speed I got was 50-60mbps. Not good when paying for 100mbps. I just replace it with a single Google Wifi Mesh unit and it is night vs day different. I am getting 110-111mbps on wifi and 170mbps down on wired.
customer_reviews.author: Randall D. Lind

customer_reviews.title: Neat features that don't work
customer_reviews.text: The information in the device list is wrong. My EA4500 is showing old/offline devices as connected, and others that are connected are showing as offline. It also is mis-identifying the IP and MAC address for several devices. Several reboots of the router don't fix it. It's been a problem almost some I bought it years ago. I hoped they would fix it with a firmware update, since it was a new router at the time. Nope. Years later and still no fix.
customer_reviews.author: J&D-T

customer_reviews.title: Great little router
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and need a strong internet access for the work I do. I have the router down in the basement and have no problem getting a signal. We have an Apple TV box, several Kindles, and ipad, laptop, and my work computer all running of this, often a couple of them going at once and it works great. Our elderly neighbor had family in town recently and needed internet access to check in for their flights home. I gave them the guest password and they were able to get on from her house. I think that is really darn good in my opinion. I am not tech savvy and had no problem setting this up.
customer_reviews.author: Ma 2 Girls

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy (relatively) to configure. Replacing my Linksys E3000 but it misses some features. I'm keeping this in place as my former E3000 is already almost 7 years old so this provides faster connection speeds. Unfortunately, there is no updated firmware to cover for the Crack and the heartbleed exploits (not that I know of)... There are no holes at the bottom so I can't hang it in the wall like I had my E3000, but I'll take care of this with a small box attached to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: alexdelara

customer_reviews.title: It’s Ok - not mind blowing
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working ok now but at the initial setup I had to reboot several times. It was easy to set up but the signal strength isn’t mind blowing. For my zoom meetings with one device running I have to often turn off the WiFi on my phone and tablet to get a steady signal.
customer_reviews.author: California Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This router keeps up with a hard line computer, four cell phones, a wi-fi computer, a PS4, an XBox, and probably my neighbors! I have yet to bog it down with data requirements. You don't have to use the Linksys software to change settings, but its worth the ten minutes to set it up and create a login. With the software I can log in anywhere and control it. The software also allows you to see who is on your network at anytime, and updates when they connect/disconnect. It has a prioritization system, but I can't notice much difference using it.
customer_reviews.author: Hatful

customer_reviews.title: Parental controls on the Linksys router are horrible, it simply fails to consistently block internet access ...
customer_reviews.text: Parental controls on the Linksys router are horrible, it simply fails to consistently block internet access at the time it's supposed to. Works for a day or so then stops working, requiring a reboot of the router to start blocking again. What a waste of money. Tech support couldn't offer any useful help either. I should have read more reviews about this product before purchasing because it appears a lot of people have similar problems. The tech support guy sure didn't seem surprised with my irritation. Don't bother Linksys, find something else that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I previously ran a E2000 router that was starting to give out. I had too many connections to it and it would kick off things that didn't get used within a few days. This alleviated my problems. I currently have 12 connections on it and handles all with ease. Extremely easy to set up with the disc and the desktop icon provides the access point to enter the router to make changes. Signal strength is great. I can sit in my neighbors living room at still be connected. (the E2000 wouldn't make it to my garage). Have no use for the gigabyte port yet, but will prove very useful when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money and time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router less than 6 months ago and it’s already dead! It was a pain to install, I didn’t know that you have to have a computer that accepts a cd for installation, perhaps I didn’t see that in the product description, but getting it installed required over 2 hours on the phone with tech help. Then, less than 6 months later is has gone bad and when I called the tech help line again after about 30 minutes with them it was determined that they couldn’t help because I only have an iPad not a computer that can plug into my modem! Argh, will not purchase this product again!
customer_reviews.author: donna willett

customer_reviews.title: Two Years Old and now a brick
customer_reviews.text: This is not an inexpensive router and CISCO/Linksys is suppose to be a top brand. However after two years it turned into a brick. Working one minute and dead the next. I went to the support site since it is no longer under warranty and tried to reset it. No luck. The funny thing is that I resurrected my old WRT54G so that I could access the internet. I just plugged it in and it worked. Linksys is no longer CISCO it is Belkin. Support is pitiful and so are the products. I'm buying an Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Sanford Lavine

customer_reviews.title: This was the easiest setup and I couldn't have been more pleased. Great product with a super quick set up
customer_reviews.text: I just received this router this afternoon. I opened the box and set it up in less than 5 minutes. I then went to the website it directed me to go to so I could finish the set up. Again, this part took me less than 5 minutes. So, in less then 10 minutes our home wireless network was back up and running perfectly. This was the easiest setup and I couldn't have been more pleased. Great product with a super quick set up. Very easy to use and easy to understand directions. Downloaded the app that goes with this router. Again, super easy interface. Love this router and very worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and Useless for Parental Controls
customer_reviews.text: The main purpose for buying the router was for the parental controls and it has failed terribly. If the router isn't rebooted daily the parental controls stop working. The parental control options are also limited and the app consistently has issues. It is not worth the money and we didn't realize it until it was after the return period.
customer_reviews.author: Mikal

customer_reviews.title: Time Waster
customer_reviews.text: The EA4500 they sold was built in 2012 and out of it's warranty period. The setup doesn't work because the disk it came with has firmware that no longer works. I spent 4 hours on the phone with Linksys help and when it would not accept the current firmware, it was deemed defective. I've sent Linksys a pic of the receipt and hopefully they will replace it. The EA4500 Amazon sold us has been an absolute nightmare and it isn't over yet. I'd like to save others from going through this.
customer_reviews.author: Meridee J

customer_reviews.title: Great Signal Strength!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this SO badly. I bought a cheap router without doing much research and it was a disaster. I spent a lot more time analyzing routers before purchasing this Linksys. It was well-reviewed and turned out to be everything I hoped it would be. The signal is strong, fast, and consistent. I rent a good sized apartment and the signal reaches to even the furthest corners. It's easy to set up and connect to your modem (plus, their customer service center is awesome). I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: DebbyBee

customer_reviews.title: Works good i tested difference brands at my house is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works good i tested difference brands at my house is a two floors concrete house, i have the office in the fist floor and i didn't received signal in the second floor, to bee honest this kind of routers won solve the issue of coverage, if you have a 2 floor house in a concrete you will need to connect another router as a repeater in the second floor. also the 5khz has low coverage in my case just cover partially the first floor so take those things in consideration if you think that we those expensive router you will solve your coverage issues. I tested cisco, belkin, TLink, the better was belkin and cisco.
customer_reviews.author: Ferkku

customer_reviews.title: Best, most reliable router I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best wireless router I've ever had. No problems and easy to set up and use. I'm pretty good with technology but it doesn't take much knowledge to install. It has plenty of power and reaches throughout and receives from everywhere in my 2200+ sq. ft. house with ease. I've owned it for quite a while now and have had no problems. There is newer and more sophisticated technology available on the market but where tech is concerned reliable beats all else. This has plenty of robust technology as well but I won't bore you with the specs you can read on the product page. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: HORSE AND BUGGY SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: I spent 45 minutes trying to register this EA4500 entering my personal data multiple times. I finally called Cisco Support and they wanted my life history, after another 15 minutes I asked if they could simply mail me a card that would allow me to register the item. They said they would connect me to customer service. After an extended hold, the phone disconnected. I was able to connect two computers and a voip phone but everything else Cisco's setup says use the item's setup instructions. I don't think that is the 3 step setup they advertised. I'll see how long this thing works before I have to junk it. I still have my ASUS that disconnects sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Mcvay

customer_reviews.title: works but install seems to always require DVD reader for Linksys products
customer_reviews.text: Bought for kids' college dorm room, still working into second semester of use. Why does Linksys expect customers to have PC with DVD for software install/configuration of unit? Do they not realize most every laptop now DOES NOT have a built-in DVD? Had to use older laptop w/ DVD to install cd software then configure unit. I've purchased about 5 Linksys routers over 15 years and they STILL seem to expect install via DVD. Get current, Linksys - get out of the dark ages of CD installs. Instructions not supplied for website software download!
customer_reviews.author: road_warrior

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace an aging Linksys. While setup was pretty easy I did have an issue getting all my Xboxes to work without NAT errors. I also had issues using Media Center. If I used more than one extender the stream would get choppy. Wireless connections were flaky at best. I thought that since I have a pretty extensive network I would go with a name known for networking, big mistake. I just replaced this with a Netgear N900 and solved all my issues. Pros: Network storage works well. Setup was pretty easy. I didn't have to use the online setup. Cons: Spotty WIFI. Dropped connections. Didn't work well with Xbox Live.
customer_reviews.author: M Dunkin

customer_reviews.title: I hate write this review
customer_reviews.text: I hate write this review, but after owning a linksys Router for years it's time to change. I had one for years and it worked flawlessly. When it finally quit working I decided to stick with linksys and get a more advanced model. Big mistake! I am now into my third one. I've spent hours on the phone with customer service and have reset my cable modem and routers more times than I can count. I've done firmware updates, I've changed settings, and today after 3 calls to linksys my router lasted about 5 hours before it quit working again! I'm done! I'm going to have to try a new brand.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Linksys disappointed again!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give Linksys another try after 5 years of using other router brands and I remember why I hated Linksys products so much. Set-up was simple but I consistently experienced intermittent connectivity on both bands and the speed when I was connected was terrible. Speed tests performed from my wireless devices were anywhere from .5 mbps to 4 mbps. I should've been getting around 9.5. Wired speeds were fine. Linksys support had be changing settings all over the place which I find crazy. Products should just work almost right out of the box with little tweaking. I returned for a Netgear N750.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lang

customer_reviews.title: Love the features. Hate the speed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to start with the cons. cons: My provider is sending 100mbps through my fiber...i'm only able to use 3.5mbps through my wireless. My provider is saying it's the router... Pros: love the "smart" features and the super easy set up via the linksys smart wifi site and app. love the media prioritization (especially with my speed issues). even the password protected guest profile was easy to set up. I have no issues with connection any where in my home. (about 1800 sq ft) I have my wireless hard drive plugged in to the usb port and it is awesome. just need my speed issues resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey O.

customer_reviews.title: O.K.-but not all that was expected
customer_reviews.text: This router will not allow the administrator to select levels of filtering like internet browser settings do. I was under the impression when I talked to customer service at Linksys that this would allow me to select devices in my household and then select the level of filtering I would like on the device. This router allows only for device selection, hours the internet is available for that device, and it will also allow the admin to input restricted internet sites.
customer_reviews.author: W. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: ... use it as an excuse for problems with their garbage equipment. This is the primary router
customer_reviews.text: The primary reason this was purchased was a to replace an older Linksys at a friend's business so Comcast couldn't use it as an excuse for problems with their garbage equipment. This is the primary router, the Comcast router is bridged in. It's great! The signal strength and speed is excellent. Will definitely be purchasing this to replace the older Linksys I have at home.
customer_reviews.author: J. H. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced a 3 year old Netgear router which was beginning to fail. The new generation Linksys routers are extremely easy to set up and configure! Set up can be done through your browser or by using the new Linksys/Cisco app that installs to the desktop. The app makes the initial configuration and any additional changes extremely easy. Wireless speeds are very fast and the strength of the signal was much better then the older router. Every room in my 2 floor house has a strong signal, which was not the case with the older router. A solid performer so far!
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: signal goes a long way, but there have been problems with weird and sudden specific website unavailability. when i change the wifi over to my phone as a hotspot, i can access the website again, so not sure what is wrong. but this thing gets the signals crossed somehow
customer_reviews.author: Larisa Butcher

customer_reviews.title: It's a Gimmick and Waste of Time!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time. I had a Linksys for years and it did great.. Thought when I upgraded to a new one it would be the same. I couldn't get the software to load and connect. Called the support line after an hour of trying only to let them log in and spend another hour on the phone to find out that they wanted to sell me more stuff.. I was so angry that I wasted my time and money. Have it packed up to send back. I'll try Netgear! Maybe they won't try to hoodoo me with a "free help" gimmick. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bcg

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...buy any other wireless router.
customer_reviews.text: I owned this wireless router for 7 months and I just replaced it since it doesn't work. The Linksys N900 wireless router worked fine for the first several months. After 4 months, I tried to access the web interface for the device and I could not log on and make adjustments. The device worked until about two weeks ago when the wireless function stopped working...the Ethernet (direct wired router worked fine.) I still could not access the web interface and I did a "hard" reboot and reset...nothing worked so now it's going into the trash can. I purchased a wireless router from a different company that had high reviews.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wu

customer_reviews.title: my e1200 seemed better. It was easier to set up
customer_reviews.text: Other then the actual speed, my e1200 seemed better. It was easier to set up,had better control over the fine tuning of my settings, and when I named my network, it gave that name to the wireless AND the wired. THIS touchy,feely app that's used to set up THIS new router,doesn't offer the same options my browser based panel did,and the new controls seem like they're designed for,shall we be polite, and say those who just push buttons and connect?
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence S

customer_reviews.title: Best router yet.
customer_reviews.text: My old TP Link grew old and died after 4 years.SO I tried a net gear, That one was a bastard to set up, and their Customer Service totally S...ed. . So I sent it back because it did not work. THen I saw this one , a few monor problems and a call to Cust. Service solved the problem. I was up and running like never before. A truly great router. golod coverage, and strong signal. in a 3600 sq. ft. home.
customer_reviews.author: Philip LaLiberte

customer_reviews.title: poor support
customer_reviews.text: finicky to get setup correctly. hardware does NOT support Open/DDWRT. firewall logs virtually dont show anything. MUST use supplied windows software to setup(and then downgrade) router. cannot connect to the internet unless this is done.very hard to diagnose this condition when first received. forces user into a web interface unless downgraded and the website to downgrade is not easy to find as it gets redirected.does support ipv6 and a/c/g modes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Jasmin

customer_reviews.title: Failed to display correct data when logged in to control panel
customer_reviews.text: The IP addresses actually assigned to various network devices, and the ones displayed when logged in to the EA4500 control panel do not always agree, and there are times when the EA4500 shows more than one IP address assigned to a device, but pinging one of those addresses gets no reply. Other than that, the unit seems to be working properly, but the data displayed by the Web based control panel is often incorrect. It often requires using a computer connected to the network, and command-line instructions to find the status of various network hardware. This is particularly true when some of the network attached items are assigned static IP addresses.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Berger

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I was using the wireless modem that Comcast so graciously RENTED me until I wised up and got the Motorola SURFboard and this unit. My wireless speed increased from 20MB to 30MB and no more reboots, or limited access. Our kids can all connect all their devices and I can stream movies in the home theater at the same time with NO problems. I really don't understand the few negative reviews of this. It works GREAT. All you do is run the CD that comes with it, plug it into the modem, and off you go. Set up took 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: ohYew812

customer_reviews.title: Good Router... solved my problem.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old router because movies were being interrupted due to a weak signal. After wondering if it was the server, broadband, download speed, the modem, or the Blueray receiver, this modem with a greater range was the perfect answer. It is also very easy to "set up" for a non-techie like me. The distance from my router to the TV is 40 feet. Now movie signals are never lost. In my quest for a solution, I found that signal repeaters, which loose 50% of the speed, was not the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Rosenwasser

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Router. :)
customer_reviews.text: This is my first router purchase and I'm extremely impressed by it's performance. So easy to hook-up a caveman can do it. "Punn Intended". It does get a little warm to the touch but not hot. I use it for hard wiring my CAT6a Cables only but have used the wireless version of it and it works flawlessly at long distances. Even though it's not out in the open but under my desk; crambed in the corner, it still performs very well. I'm glad Cisco/Linksys are still making outstanding products. I hope my review helps those considering to purchase this product. I highly recommend it. Peace to all: :)
customer_reviews.author: Cigarjohn47

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace the Cisco Valet M20, since the M20 Cisco Connect software was not updated for the newest Mac OS (Mountain Lion). The EA4500 was easy to set up (full disclosure, I am a career geek and retired CIO), and the signal is very strong throughout my whole house and on the lanai (Floridian for screened-in patio). I have been very pleased with the performance of the router, and throughput speed has been consistently very fast. It has never lost or dropped connection with any of my numerous devices. I would highly recommend this router to anyone who want a home/small office high end wireless router. Cisco/Linksys make great products. Buy this router with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: dcbart

customer_reviews.title: I AM VERY HAPPY I PURCHASED THIS MODEL
customer_reviews.text: HAVE HAD THIS ROUTER FOR SOME TIME NOW, I AM VERY HAPPY I PURCHASED THIS MODEL!! THE N900 RUNS FAR COOLER THAN PREVIOUS MODEL WE HAD!!! THE INTERFACE & SET-UP IS FAR EASIER THAN PREVIOUS ROUTERS. PERFORMANCE OF SPEED IS VERY GOOD IF CONNECTED TO FAST INTERNET SERVICE! IN THE INTERFACE PAGES OF THE N900 EVEN HAS A SPEED CHECK WHICH FOUND VERY HELPFUL TO COMPARE WITH CABLE COMPANY READINGS!!! FOR THE PRICE I FEEL IT WAS A WORTH WHILE PURCHASE & IMPROVEMENT OF OUR HOME NETWORK!!! WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr.M

customer_reviews.title: GREAT router worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.text: Love this router. DUMP your Comcast router and get this. I was ALWAYS having problems with my signal and wireless strength in the house. As soon as I bought this we never have trouble anymore. Almost daily I was going to my Comcast router and having to reboot it. Since buying this router I NEVER reboot. Goodbye Comcast router and your extra charges for your crappy equipment!!
customer_reviews.author: Chantay Foley

customer_reviews.title: EA4500 Firmaware upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the EA4500 because of all the advances. I was especially interested in being able to view my wireless cameras from different devices with the Cisco cloud. The router set up easily and devices previously connected to my old system connected. After upgrading the firmware, I found out the app to view my cameras via the cloud were only available for Apple products (Ipad, Iphone, etc). I would not have spent the time loading the firmware had I known that in advance. If the manufacturer said that info was available, it certainly was not obvious. Good product, but wish they were more upfront.
customer_reviews.author: ISU Bob

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY EA4500
customer_reviews.text: *** DO NOT BUY *** This router has a 'smart' setup utility that DOES NOT WORK. Even though I could see the router on my Ethernet adapter, the setup utility could not find it. There may have been a fix in the dozens of pages on the Linksys community pages, but I didn't find one that wasn't convoluted and required repeating frequently. (Goodle 'linksys ea4500 setup problems'). I tried to find a newer setup as recommended by Linksys, but it doesn't exist. I returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy P. Beard

customer_reviews.title: Grab The Asus N66U Instead
customer_reviews.text: I returned this router due it's absolute HORRIBLE 5GHz wireless performance. Certainly not worth the money. The management interface is nice for someone that likes shiny and flashy things, but for a power user it's really very non-functional. I'd absolutely love this if the Asus N66U was not on the market, but at the very close price, there's no reason for anyone to buy this 'app-enabled' router. One plus however, was the handling of DLNA streaming with a USB external hard drive. I threw a 2TB HDD on the USB port filled with over 4000 video files and it handled it like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: S. Parikh

customer_reviews.title: Linksys N900 WiFi Router Working Well
customer_reviews.text: Installed this dual band wireless router a few months ago. It's working just fine. We had a range reception problem with our older router. The Linksys N900 fixed that completely. No more signal reception problems in our house.
customer_reviews.author: howard

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried about purchasing this wireless router after reading many less than positive reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised. I purchased this product because it was one of the top rated wireless routers on CNET. It's been 2 months now without any issues at all with this device. I am able to stream HD video pretty reliably on my wireless devices (Tablets & Phones). We have not had to change settings, or restart the router at any point. It also seems to run cooler than my previous wireless router, it's small, and blends against a black table top.
customer_reviews.author: towerXVI

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Have this for a couple of weeks now and so far had not experienced any hiccups yet, hopefully not ever. Im very happy with this model. Set up was a breeze, it practically almost installed itself. UI is well designed and easy to understand as well. Couldnt be more happier. I have not measured any speed test or signal & range test but so far all the gadgets connected on this router has a solid connection all the time. I know theres a lot of newer models out there but this one is solid & i would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dee

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace the Linksys WRT54G form 10 years ago. This model didn't have some of the better capabilities the WRT54g had like internet blocking in 5 minute chunks, only 1 hour blocks. Not a deal breaker. The Parental controls are average at best. I updated with OpenDNS servers on the router and my kids net surfing is pretty safe now. The big bonus on this unit is the remote accessibility. I can turn on the internet from work or anywhere around the world from my mac. We need a mobile version for increased accessibility.
customer_reviews.author: TTX_TRI

customer_reviews.title: So far a big Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a fried E3000 that lasted about 2 years. Read all the reviews and while some were negative to some update, they were dated in 2012 so I figured that likely did not apply anymore and was history...the update issue. Very easy to set up and using the same SSID and Pass-code all of my devices easily found and auto connected. Easy stuff and nice software making managing the router and the additional features a breeze. Easy install, lots of output on the signal and a happy camper at this point!
customer_reviews.author: Forest Barbieri

customer_reviews.title: Reliable?  It's never gone down and was easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, after multiple years of operation, a router that has never gone down or given me a lick of problems. Install was easy and worked the first time. With my provider, Charter Spectrum, the Linksys Router has multiple computers hard wired and an older laptop that sits in my garage (approximately 65 feet away) and gets used heavily, all work well with this router. Speed delivery is much better than my old unit and I am very happy and glad I went with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Yar Mosnar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: This router is great. You need to follow directions and have an general understanding of what you're doing though. Do not have it update the firmware if you are not familiar with what that does. You will probably need to hard reset your modem if you are upgrading from another router...unplug power and cable/DSL connection, wait a few minutes, plug it all back in, as well as reboot your computer. I bought this as an upgrade from a previous Linksys that no longer gave the coverage I needed. Everything I have hooked to this works great...wireless printer, smart tv, cell phones, blu ray, etc.
customer_reviews.author: SDJ73

customer_reviews.title: Need for speed
customer_reviews.text: I finally upgraded from wireless G technology to N. I needed a faster and reliable router capable of handling video streaming from 8 surveillance cameras and all of our internet traffic (movies, videos, music, games, photos). I hit a bump during installation. Linksys technical support was very helpful. Beware when you buy this product you are not covered from other vendors Linksys will offer you assistance for a short period. I bought 1 year support for $19.99. Linksys offers free shipping. The slick design is very appealing. It works flawlessly. I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lourdes

customer_reviews.title: Manages All Your Devices
customer_reviews.text: When reviewing this router it's important to keep in mind that the software is equally important. Linksys by Cisco has taken the time to make a nice piece of software that makes it very easy to manage and prioritize your devices on this router. The router itself works exactly as advertised and we're running multiple computers, smartphones, tablets, and a gaming console off of this without an issue. I will knock one star for the price. This router is great but we ended up buying a refurbished model due to the high price. If you go that route I would recommend getting factory refurbished so that you get the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Surragard

customer_reviews.title: Not linksys's best effort
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about 6 months, but had to replace after less than a year due to lack of bandwidth causing dropped wireless. Only way to fix was to reboot, which was a daily occurrence. Also got extremely hot Standard interface simplistic, and option free. Did not try the web interface, and is not compatable with ddwrt or other open source firmware. All in all linksys have last their way. Replaced with a ASus 68ac - blows this out the water! For the money spent v.overpriced
customer_reviews.author: T. Boyle

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED Changed from 5 star to 1 star
customer_reviews.text: Great, fast, gigabit router! The setup was fast and easy. The phone app is also very useful to monitor your internet and who is on it. *UPDATED* Changed from 5 to 1 Router constantly drops connection throughout the house and requires restarts, save you're money and by a different router. Also there are no idicator lights which can be a pain. I switched to the Asus RT ACRH13 and couldn't be happier. A lot better coverage and hasn't dropped signal or required a restart yet.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Boland

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but for the money, buy Unify!
customer_reviews.text: Started with this, it worked ok, but had drops constantly in my house. Switched to Unify and eliminated all issues. If you have a small place and not many devices, go for it. If you have a family, many devices, a large house, buy the unify line. It's worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Prosser

customer_reviews.title: Nice Next Generation Option
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router as a replacement for an E1000. The E1000 was working properly but it was like 3 years old. The range on the E1000 diminished over time so I thought I would upgrade to the EA4500 and the range would improve. Unfortunately the range on this newer model is the same as the E1000. It's not all bad the speed on this EA4500 is way faster than the E1000 so it's not a complete loss. These models of routers are so simple to setup and very dependable. I would buy another one in a heartbeat. Amazon had this for a great price so I'm satified with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jessy J

customer_reviews.title: Needs some tweaking
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice looking router and works well after some tweaking, had problems at first with my phone taking forever to connect. Cant remmeber what finally fixed that but I do technical support for a ISP and tweaked a bunch of little things and now it works as expected. Still only a 4 star because out of the box it was slower to connect than my 5 year old router! But now its better.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Gould

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless range/speed
customer_reviews.text: PRO 1. Very reliable wireless router. Does not require frequent power on/off cycle. 2. Good wireless range/speed. 2.4 band (802.11G is able to cover a 3000 SqFt single resident, 802.11N will reduce coverage by 20%), and with 5.0 Band, (802.11A (no C), the coverage drop to limit inside the same room with the router. 3. easy to setup and managing connection CON 1. for 5.0 Band, only A is available; no C 2. The USB port is 2.0 3. No LED indicating Rx/Tx movement
customer_reviews.author: Duty Free

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 weeks then have to constantly reboot it.
customer_reviews.text: Been through 2 of these is the last 2 months. For the first 2 weeks works amazing( except the 5 ghz band never worked on either ) then have to constantly reboot it to get wifi back. As an IT having to reboot this router 2x a day is a unacceptable. Amazon is amazing thought out this ordeal. Making the exchange painless. And I definitely will be buying from amazon again bc of this. For now I think I will stick with acheap 50$ linksys router like I had
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Fast Fast Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router. I previously was using an Apple Base Station router. I love Apple products and I have several Apple computers, iPhones, iPads, and iPods in our household, however the Apple router just could not handle as many devices. The EA4500 fixed all of my problems and is incredible fast. I have a 5000 sq foot home with the router in a basement office. I got decent reception in all areas of home. I did add a wireless extender which gives me full bars of service throughout. Love this router! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: D. McCaffrey

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different router!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's cheap, and you get exactly what you pay for... complete garbage. Worked fine for 3 months but now I have to reboot it every hour to keep the thing connected to my cable modem. Not even going to try to deal with their terrible customer service. I took a chance despite the load of 1-star reviews lately, so now I am writing this review to hopefully save others the trouble. Don't waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you want to print wireless
customer_reviews.text: Wired devices work fine, but the wireless printing is the worst I've ever seen by far. I've browsed both the Linksys and Lexmark (my printer manufacturer) websites and have found numerous others who have the same issues. It can take up to 20 minutes to print one color page wireless. My printer is listed as being compatible with this router on the Linksys documentation. If I could rate this less than one star I would. Choose another brand if you want wireless printing. My printer worked fine wireless until this router was installed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Linksys N900 Wifi wireless Duel Band Router
customer_reviews.text: I used linksys for served years. I got this one for my parents they need new wireless route I suggest to this Linksys where they have many devices they would get better service with Linksys duel band. They are very happy with it special my father now get on Netflix without any problems as for it took for ever get load not now it's fast and quicker. Yes I would highly recommend Linksys Duel Band Router.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought the EA4500 in late november 2012. it quit working in march 2013. the company won't let me send it back to be repaired under the one year warranty unless i pay them thirty dollars to troubleshoot the router first. i thought cisco was a reputable company and payed their price thinking i was getting a good product from a good company. they are just grubbing for more money. i will never buy another cisco product! i should have bought a cheep router
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Major Problem
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this router UNTIL I recently bought a new computer running Windows 8. While the software installed easily on my previous Windows 7 computer, it would not install on my new computer. I contacted Linksys technical support today, and was advised that there is not as yet (May, 2014) software or drivers for Windows 8. To be fair, my new computer does connect with the router, but I cannot control the router (password protect the network, for example) because there is no software or drivers for Windows 8. The Linksys technician I spoke with could not tell me when software and drivers for Windows 8 would be available.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Prof

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived just in time to save me from the horrible "No Wi-Fi for over a week withdrawals - nothing to do but clean house :( Bless You! :D Your product was so EASY to get up and running - read: no assembly required! I've got my phone, two tablets, and my computer up and running and am pretty happy with the world :D Thanks for a product that does what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.author: TrudyNC

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Good speed. Fails in one year.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! It not supporting HDD larger than 3GB and only some specific brands was a setback but network speed makes up for that. The help desk is great too!! I would recommend this any day. Update: Started giving me a hard time with frequent disconnections exactly after a year of use. Too bad there is no warranty remaining. I'll have to get a new one now :(
customer_reviews.author: sneak_pigeon

customer_reviews.title: my best touter so far
customer_reviews.text: i used cisco by long time, and it is the best so far, aldo it doesnt work in ac, for a dual band network like mine, it work perfect. and the remote configurattion is the best, the parental control works perfect, just a little complications configuring the folder share, but if u know wath u doing, u will be ok. i love it. pd. beware with the contrller of the internet traffic, and the prioritation of devices, it may be put your cellular to fligh and your tablet to walk. if u know wath i mean.
customer_reviews.author: codk

customer_reviews.title: WIFI for all.
customer_reviews.text: Router works great and is easy to set up either by using the auto mode or by going into the router from your computer. Make sure you have a direct connection to the router the first time to make it easy. I set different passwords for the wifi and to access the setup menu. I have not had any problems with Linksys and the wireless N is as fast as you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Cigar Smoke

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: I like this unit although the range is not as far as I wanted but it does cover my whole house. I like the feature which allows you to give guests a temporary password without disclosing your permanent password. We have lots of company and I always wonder how secure my network is when I have to give internet access to guests. Set up was a snap and it is easy to remotely add devices to the network without having to be at the unit itself. You can also see what devices are active on your network from your iPhone or iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Boater in Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Wifi easy install!
customer_reviews.text: You can believe the hype! Love love love this router! Super easy install, you do nothing but insert the disc! My upload and download sped increased as well! Can't say enough good things about this router! I'm almost considering getting rid of my apple airport utility and getting another router for my upstairs modem but I want to see if the signal from this one is strong enough to reach that side of the house since the one I replaced isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon2010

customer_reviews.title: Firmware update is optional
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Does what it is supposed to do......to wireless transport internet signals The firmware update for cloud connect -an issue which has spawned so many acidic reviews- is now optional. While setting it up I was given that option and I declined. Maybe this is something new and I should thank the other reviewers for their efforts :) Overall, I am extremely satisfied with this router. Build quality is excellent and looks great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: WI FI part works fine, but will not recognize my desktop computer is ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was quick, but the actual router doesn't work correctly. WI FI part works fine, but will not recognize my desktop computer is plugged into it. So every time we want to use the internet on the desktop, we have to unplug and plug it in to the different ethernet plugs until it finally recognizes the computer. Had to wait for someone to install the router for me, so was too late to return. Had 2 different professionals tell me the same thing was wrong with it.Bought a Linksys because I thought I was buying quality, but I guess not.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Sukowaty

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent performance, not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: From the get go, this router had the tendency to drop the line and stop working. It would go for two days straight, and then not work for several hours. Resetting had little effect. I called Linksys support several times, and finally they sent a replacement. The replacement has the same problems with dropping the line, sometimes for hours. Two routers and several service calls. I cannot recommend this product. Contacting support is an adventure. My next router will be with a different vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lysik

customer_reviews.title: Should last longer than 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a little over a year. When it works it works well and it is very easy to configure. But lately it has been going dead a couple times a day and I need to restart it to bring it back.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Easy to set up.I get 4bars in the bedroom.Has guest access.I had a Cisco Valet which set up using a USB stick.This Linksys Cisco sets up using a CD. I wish it had a USB stick. That is my only complaint.I had previously bought a TP link but the router did not display the router name. This one displays the router name. Easy to coonect Roku and Amazon Fire Stick. I highly recommend the Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Granite

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scope of coverage and ability to shield (and not broadcast) SSIDs.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these in homes, businesses and elderly care centers. They are dependable and have great wi-fi range and all needed security features. I would recommend buying these new or reconditioned. I have had some in place for 5 years and they have not failed yet!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Shaw

customer_reviews.title: needs and wants
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new router and I wanted to be able to secure the children's computer to not have internet access after a certain hour and this has that ability. I had a problem setting it up but the customer service took care of it with no problem. They do try to sell you a service that will take care of up to 3 computers and the router. I am just telling you this so you will be informed when you call them.
customer_reviews.author: 69 wanna B

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Easy install! LOVING it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this (and a new cable modem) as Christmas present for my husband who's upstairs PC had lots of issues holding a signal. Even his netbook downstairs couldn't play video w/o constant buffering. Wow, what a difference! Now it's just humming along! No dropped signal upstairs and streaming works great! Should have done this long ago. Haven't had much need for the app on my iPhone, but it works just fine. I've checked away from home and enable Mac filtering and changed Guest password with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: PghPammy

customer_reviews.title: I've Reviewed the EA6500...
customer_reviews.text: ...and purchased this for another customer who didn't need all of the EA6500 bells and whistles. Outstanding products (now). Before, Linksys simply stamped the word "Cisco" on their equipment and that was supposed to get us to believe there was Cisco tech within. Some of us are not easily fooled by that tactic. We therefore stopped buying Linksys products. Now that it is apparent that Linksys is employing Cisco experience in the field - that shows in the spectacular performance of this series of wireless routers - we have started purchasing Linksys products again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian McQuaig

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what all of the complaints are.
customer_reviews.text: This router does not need an online account registered like everyone seems to be complaining about. There is a little link on the router page to bypass that. The router works well and is easy to set up, but has very little features compared to most routers I have used in the past. My only real complaint is that for some reason I cannot connect to my home network using WEP with this router unless i turn my PC to unsecured. Every other router I was able to.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B

customer_reviews.title: Defects
customer_reviews.text: This Linksys router offers many nice features, easy to connect devices and configure them like cameras. However, this router stopped communication with my modem. It lights up, it show you wireless network name but it does not transfer my modem internet connection. It loses signal when it rain also, even when it's hardwired. Had it for 33 days when it decided to die. Now I am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Ameran

customer_reviews.title: Its a tested technology and it works, but beware of using it as a bridge
customer_reviews.text: I chose this technology over the newer AC upcoming standard because I needed it to work reliably for a friend with a very large home who is not within physical troubleshooting distance. I bought two of these so that I could use one as a wired bridge (the cost difference between buying a true AP vs another router was irrelevant for me on this project). BE AWARE...the product works just fine, but if you want to setup these newer linksys media routers as a bridge you MUST configure both routers manually and not with the "easy to use" software, or else, it just will not work. Documentation is thin on this matter.
customer_reviews.author: stevenl

customer_reviews.title: Extends my network throughout my house.
customer_reviews.text: I have three story house, basement where my office and server network connection is located, a middle floor where we have our main living space in including a smart TV and a Roku box on another set, and a top floor with a couple of gust bedrooms. With this router we are able to connect to our Wi-Fi network from anywhere in the house, including the deck and screened porch, without any degradation of speed or function. We can check our email or run nay apps on on any of the devices we, or our guest use. Plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: DaveNC

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect with Cox set-up
customer_reviews.text: This router exceeded my expectations. Signal strength is impressive. Works perfect with Cox set-up. Worth every penny! The price is great. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a powerful yet affordable router!!
customer_reviews.author: Robin D Cogswell

customer_reviews.title: Good router for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This router gives a good strong signal throughout my house. I haven't had any problems since I purchased the router and it was a good price. I purchased an additional year of support. I was disappointed when I learned Linksys does not offer any additional support after that year unless you purchase another router. However, the app for this product works good and I don't think I would really need additional support.
customer_reviews.author: abscott1703

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up, fast and good range
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace my older Linksys router to get better range and 802.11N. I was not dissapointed. The setup was a snap and I now get full bars at the other end of the house with my iPad. Like most consumer routers, it has only 4 ports for your equipment so I also bought a Cisco switch to get 8 more ports (of course, you give up one port on each to connect them so you wind up with 10 free ports). Auto sensing and the setup wizard make installation a breeze. Both have been running flawlessly and untouched with both Windows, Linux and iOS machines since installation.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Received the router & had it up and running in no time. The range is great. I needed to send signal outside to a repeater located several feet away that needed to bounce the signal 3 doors down. It worked! My husband's laptop was constantly dropping the signal with our old router. That hasn't happened since we have installed this router and it's been over a week. Before, the signal was dropped several times a day- he was ready to toss the laptop. Noting but praise for this one!
customer_reviews.author: poohbearsmom

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the increasingly wireless home!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older Linksys router because it couldn't handle the increased number of Wi-Fi devices in our house. This one does a great job! The range is much better and we can connect many devices simultaneously without any lags. Between smart phones and smart TVs, Blu-ray players and Wi-Fi enabled receivers, Kindles, computers, and laptops, this is a great router for the wireless house.
customer_reviews.author: Montyloon

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage in a 3 story town home
customer_reviews.text: Great coverage in a 3 story town home. This unit is in the basement and gives clear signal on the third floor (many WiFi devices have good horizontal coverage, but lack in the vertical coverage). The setup is easy and speed is solid!
customer_reviews.author: SamuraiJack42

customer_reviews.title: Use
customer_reviews.text: this unit was use and it was sold to me as a new one .Did'nt get the CD with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Hate this Router
customer_reviews.text: Hate this Router!!!! I have used Linksys devices before and liked them, but this model made me swear off Linksys for good! Connected to Samsung Smart TV without issue, but when connected to Android phones it is slower than old fashion dial-up. Tried to go back into system interface and all I get is error messages. Went to the Linksys webpage and attempted to find the error message resolution - Yeah no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Linksys never disappoints
customer_reviews.text: Linksys never disappoints. After trying a few other brands I came back to linksys. I am not doing any fancy or need special setting on my network, I just want to plug in a router and have fast WiFi speeds for multiple devices. This did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Davis R. Best

customer_reviews.title: Take my money!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best router I've had to date. I've trusted the brand for years and highly recommend but this router is great.
customer_reviews.author: Rayvyn

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from DIR-655 and No update problem!
customer_reviews.text: (See G. Haney on the Dir 655). I too made this upgrade. The first thing it did was the update and I have had no bad issues at all. I did get a faster speed test every time I have run the test and better WiFi thoughout the house. A side item I noticed was that it took care of an issue I hade with my IP-phone service and has not returned. I have used the EA4500 for a few of months now and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great Router after some changes
customer_reviews.text: After some changes to the original software this router comes with works great. Warning you will not be able to use any cloud software after this downgrade. I downgraded to version 2.0.37, Disabled WPS, and changed channel to 9. Also noticed that the signal is much better is router is mounted on the wall and not set flat on a table. Only problem I had was the 5GHZ connection keeps dropping off on APPLE Laptops. Other then that I am very satisfied with the router performance.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Great one durable and great signal covering
customer_reviews.text: great one, a lot of functionalities on the web administration, great covering even through walls inside the appartment,
customer_reviews.author: David Enrique Hurtado

customer_reviews.title: Great consumer level Router
customer_reviews.text: I have installed many routers in my time. The EA 4500 is by far the best wireless router out there. Easy to install with Dual Band and 2 Wlan segments. Guest and user . Coverage is great ,I installed it on the second floor of a 3 level home. Up right on the wall under the staircase(like a door bell) and it gives full coverage top to bottom of the home.The smart wifi makes it easy to configure and manage.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Not a great signal...
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work well in my house. The wifi signal is very weak, even close by and it doesn't reach some of the further areas. I had to buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: ThunderSam

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to setup and got my wifi extenders synchronized to ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it today. It was easy to setup and got my wifi extenders synchronized to it. I notice a big difference in my wifi experience! I've had Netgear, TP-Link, and an older Linksys. As a matter of fact, I was so pleased with the performance from the older E300 that's why I went the N900. If you're gonna go with a sidecar router, go with Linksys!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Rogers
